intro: Normania, commonly known as the common thyme, is a hardy perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, opposite leaves that are often gray-green in color. Its flowers are usually pink or white, forming dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Normania is valued for its culinary and medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
